content:
MetaForeignKeyColumn Class

In this Article

Represents a database foreign-key field that is used by ASP.NET Dynamic Data.

Syntax

Declaration

public class MetaForeignKeyColumn : System.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn
  • MetaForeignKeyColumn

Remarks

In ASP.NET Dynamic Data applications, the MetaForeignKeyColumn class represents a database column that denotes a one-to-one relationship.

The MetaForeignKeyColumn class represents the column in the table that contains the foreign-key field. However, you can access the parent table object by using the ParentTable property. You can determine if the foreign-key field is a primary key in the table that contains it by using the IsPrimaryKeyInThisTable property.

Constructors summary

MetaForeignKeyColumn(MetaTable,ColumnProvider)

Initializes a new instance of the MetaForeignKeyColumn class.

Properties summary

ForeignKeyNames

Gets a collection that contains the names of the foreign keys in the association that represents a database relationship.
IsPrimaryKeyInThisTable

Gets a value that indicates whether the foreign-key field is part of the primary key of the table.
ParentTable

Gets the parent table of the foreign-key field.

Methods summary

ExtractForeignKey(IDictionary,String)

Saves the value of a foreign key in the specified dictionary.
GetFilterExpression(String)

Returns the alternate name that is mapped to a foreign key.
GetForeignKeyDetailsPath(Object)

Gets the path for the details action page of the parent table of the specified foreign-key field.
GetForeignKeyPath(String,Object)

Gets the path for the specified action page of the parent table of the specified foreign-key field.
GetForeignKeyPath(String,Object,String)

Gets the path for the specified action page of the parent table of the specified foreign-key field.
GetForeignKeyString(Object)

Retrieves a comma-separated list of values that represent the foreign-key for the specified row.
GetForeignKeyValues(Object)

Retrieves a collection of values that represent the foreign keys for the specified row.
Initialize()

Initializes data that may not be available when the constructor is called.

Constructors

  • MetaForeignKeyColumn(MetaTable,ColumnProvider)

    Initializes a new instance of the MetaForeignKeyColumn class.

    public MetaForeignKeyColumn (System.Web.DynamicData.MetaTable table, System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider entityMember);

    Parameters

    • table
      MetaTable

      The entity meta table.

    • entityMember
      ColumnProvider

      The entity column provider.

Properties

  • ForeignKeyNames

    Gets a collection that contains the names of the foreign keys in the association that represents a database relationship.

    public System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<string> ForeignKeyNames { get; }

    Property Value

    • ReadOnlyCollection<String>

      A collection that contains the names of the foreign keys.

  • IsPrimaryKeyInThisTable

    Gets a value that indicates whether the foreign-key field is part of the primary key of the table.

    public bool IsPrimaryKeyInThisTable { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the foreign-key field is part of the primary key of the table; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Use the IsPrimaryKeyInThisTable property to determine whether the foreign-key field is part of the primary key of the table. This is the table that contains the foreign-key field not the parent table.

  • ParentTable

    Gets the parent table of the foreign-key field.

    public System.Web.DynamicData.MetaTable ParentTable { get; }

    Property Value

    • MetaTable

      The parent table of the foreign-key field.

Methods

  • ExtractForeignKey(IDictionary,String)

    Saves the value of a foreign key in the specified dictionary.

    public void ExtractForeignKey (System.Collections.IDictionary dictionary, string value);

    Parameters

    • dictionary
      IDictionary

      A dictionary object that contains the new values for a data field.

    • value
      String

      The value of the foreign key.

    Remarks

    The ExtractForeignKey method is used to save the value of a foreign key in the dictionary that contains all the new values for a data field. Typically, the ExtractForeignKey method is used when a new value is selected from a DropDownList control for the foreign key field.

  • GetFilterExpression(String)

    Returns the alternate name that is mapped to a foreign key.

    public string GetFilterExpression (string foreignKeyName);

    Parameters

    • foreignKeyName
      String

      The name of the foreign key.

    Returns

    • String

      The alternate name that is mapped to the foreign key.

    Remarks

    This method returns the alternate name that is used in a filtering expression instead of the actual foreign-key name. If an alternate name does not exist, the method returns the actual name of the foreign key.

  • GetForeignKeyDetailsPath(Object)

    Gets the path for the details action page of the parent table of the specified foreign-key field.

    public string GetForeignKeyDetailsPath (object row);

    Parameters

    • row
      Object

      The row that contains the foreign-key field.

    Returns

    • String

      The path for the details action page of the parent table of the specified foreign-key field.

    Remarks

    The GetForeignKeyDetailsPath method returns the path for the details action page based on the routes defined for the ASP.NET Dynamic Data application. This method returns an empty string, if row is null.

    Using the GetForeignKeyDetailsPath method is the same as invoking the GetForeignKeyPath(String,Object) method passing the Details action as the first parameter.

  • GetForeignKeyPath(String,Object)

    Gets the path for the specified action page of the parent table of the specified foreign-key field.

    public string GetForeignKeyPath (string action, object row);

    Parameters

    • action
      String

      The target action.

    • row
      Object

      The row that contains the foreign-key field.

    Returns

    • String

      The path for the specified action page of the parent table of the specified foreign-key field.

    Remarks

    The GetForeignKeyPath method returns the path for the specified action page based on the routes defined for the ASP.NET Dynamic Data application. This method returns an empty string, if row is null.

    You can use the values defined in the PageAction class for the action parameter.

  • GetForeignKeyPath(String,Object,String)

    Gets the path for the specified action page of the parent table of the specified foreign-key field.

    public string GetForeignKeyPath (string action, object row, string path);

    Parameters

    • action
      String

      The target action.

    • row
      Object

      The row that contains the foreign-key field.

    • path
      String

      The target page.

    Returns

    • String

      The path for the specified action page of the parent table of the specified foreign-key field.

    Remarks

    The GetForeignKeyPath(String,Object) method returns the path for the specified action page based on the specified path. This method returns an empty string, if row is null.

    You can use the values defined in the PageAction class for the action parameter.

  • GetForeignKeyString(Object)

    Retrieves a comma-separated list of values that represent the foreign-key for the specified row.

    public string GetForeignKeyString (object row);

    Parameters

    • row
      Object

      The row to retrieve the foreign-key values for.

    Returns

    • String

      A comma-separated list of values that represent the foreign key for the specified row.

    Remarks

    The GetForeignKeyString method returns the same values that are returned by the GetForeignKeyValues method, but in a different format.

  • GetForeignKeyValues(Object)

    Retrieves a collection of values that represent the foreign keys for the specified row.

    public System.Collections.Generic.IList<object> GetForeignKeyValues (object row);

    Parameters

    • row
      Object

      The row to retrieve the foreign-key values for.

    Returns

    • IList<Object>

      A collection of values that represent the foreign keys for the specified row.

    Remarks

    The GetForeignKeyValues method returns the same values that are returned by the GetForeignKeyString method, but in a different format.

  • Initialize()

    Initializes data that may not be available when the constructor is called.

    protected override void Initialize ();

    Remarks

    This method cannot be called directly. To customize initialization, you can derive from this class and override the Initialize method. If you override this method, call the base control's Initialize method.
